titleStmt.title: Gregorii posthuma, or, Certain learned tracts written by John Gregorie. Together with a short account of the author's life and elegies on his much-lamented death published by J.G.
titleStmt.author: Gregory, John, 1607-1646.
Gurgany, John, 1606 or 7-1675.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by William Du-gard for Laurence Sadler,

notesStmt.note: Each tract, except the first, has a special t.p.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.

A discourse of the LXX interpreters, the place and manner of their interpretation--A discourse declaring what time the Nicene Creed began to bee sung in the church--A sermon upon the Resurrection, from 1 Cor., 15. Ver. 20--Kainan deuteros, or, A disproof of him, in the 3d of S. Luke Ver. 36--Episcopus puerorum in die innocentium--De aeris & epochis, shewing the several accounts of time among all nations from the creation to the present age--The Assyrian monarchie, beeing a short description of it's rise and fall--The description and use of the terrestrial globe.
